title: Sautéed Peppers with Zucchini and Mint
introduction: This delightful dish of sautéed peppers and zucchini offers a fresh and vibrant medley of flavors. Complemented by the mint's refreshing note and a hint of white wine vinegar, it becomes more delicious over time, making it perfect for early preparation for later enjoyment.
instructions: Stand the peppers on a cutting board. Holding the stem in one hand, place the cutting edge of a large heavy chef's knife just beyond the edge of the cap. Cut straight down. Turn the pepper 90° and cut straight down again. Repeat, turning and cutting the remaining two sides. Discard the core, seeds, and stem, which will be in one piece. Cut away any membranes and scrape out any seeds. Cut the peppers into 1-inch strips.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the peppers and cook, stirring, for 10 minutes.
Add the zucchini and salt to taste. Cook, stirring often, until the zucchini are tender, about 15 minutes.
While the vegetables are cooking, in a medium bowl, whisk together the vinegar, garlic, herbs, red pepper, and salt to taste.
Stir in the peppers and zucchini. Let stand until the vegetables are at room temperature. Taste and adjust seasoning.
